g3501.definition: [νέος] including the comparative νεότερος; a primary word; "new", i.e. (of persons) youthful, or (of things) fresh; figuratively, regenerate

g3504.definition: [νεόφυτος] from {{g3501}} and a derivative of {{g5453}}; newly planted, i.e. (figuratively) a young convert ("neophyte")

g3505.definition: [Νέρων] of Latin origin; Neron (i.e. Nero), a Roman emperor

g3506.definition: [νεύω] apparently a primary verb; to "nod", i.e. (by analogy), signal

g3507.definition: [νεφέλη] from {{g3509}}; properly, cloudiness, i.e. (concretely) a cloud

g3508.definition: [Νεφθαλείμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h5321}}); Nephthaleim (i.e. Naphthali), a tribe in Palestine

g3509.definition: [νέφος] apparently a primary word; a cloud

g3510.definition: [νεφρός] of uncertain affinity; a kidney (plural), i.e. (figuratively) the inmost mind

g3511.definition: [νεωκόρος] from a form of {{g3485}} and κορέω (to sweep); a temple-servant, i.e. (by implication) a votary

g3512.definition: [νεωτερικός] from the comparative of {{g3501}}; appertaining to younger persons, i.e. juvenile

g3513.definition: [νή] probably an intensive form of {{g3483}}; a particle of attestation (accompanied by the object invoked or appealed to in confirmation); as sure as

g3514.definition: [νήθω] from νέω (of like meaning); to spin

g3515.definition: [νηπιάζω] from {{g3516}}; to act as a babe, i.e. (figuratively) innocently

g3516.definition: [νήπιος] from an obsolete particle νή- (implying negation) and {{g2031}}; not speaking, i.e. an infant (minor); figuratively, a simple-minded person, an immature Christian

g3517.definition: [Νηρεύς] apparently from a derivative of the base of {{g3491}} (meaning wet); Nereus, a Christian

g3518.definition: [Νηρί] of Hebrew origin ({{h5374}}); Neri (i.e. Nerijah), an Israelite

g3520.definition: [νῆσος] probably from the base of {{g3491}}; an island

g3521.definition: [νηστεία] from {{g3522}}; abstinence (from lack of food, or voluntary and religious); specially, the fast of the Day of Atonement

g3523.definition: [νῆστις] from the inseparable negative particle νή- (not) and {{g2068}}; not eating, i.e. abstinent from food (religiously)

g3525.definition: [νήφω] of uncertain affinity; to abstain from wine (keep sober), i.e. (figuratively) be discreet

g3526.definition: [Νίγερ] of Latin origin; black; Niger, a Christian

g3527.definition: [Νικάνωρ] probably from {{g3528}}; victorious; Nicanor, a Christian

g3529.definition: [νίκη] apparently a primary word; conquest (abstractly), i.e. (figuratively) the means of success

g3530.definition: [Νικόδημος] from {{g3534}} and {{g1218}}; victorious among his people; Nicodemus, an Israelite

g3531.definition: [Νικολαΐτης] from {{g3532}}; a Nicolaïte, i.e. adherent of Nicolaüs

g3532.definition: [Νικόλαος] from {{g3534}} and {{g2992}}; victorious over the people; Nicolaüs, a heretic

g3533.definition: [Νικόπολις] from {{g3534}} and {{g4172}}; victorious city; Nicopolis, a place in Macedonia

g3534.definition: [νῖκος] from {{g3529}}; a conquest (concretely), i.e. (by implication) triumph

g3535.definition: [Νινευΐ] of Hebrew origin ({{h5210}}); Ninevi (i.e. Nineveh), the capital of Assyria

g3536.definition: [Νινευΐτης] from {{g3535}}; a Ninevite, i.e. inhabitant of Nineveh

g3538.definition: [νίπτω] to cleanse (especially the hands or the feet or the face); ceremonially, to perform ablution Compare {{g3068}}.

g3539.definition: [νοιέω] from {{g3563}}; to exercise the mind (observe), i.e. (figuratively) to comprehend, heed

g3540.definition: [νόημα] from {{g3539}}; a perception, i.e. purpose, or (by implication) the intellect, disposition, itself

g3541.definition: [νόθος] of uncertain affinity; a spurious or illegitimate son

g3542.definition: [νομή] feminine from the same as {{g3551}}; pasture, i.e. (the act) feeding (figuratively, spreading of a gangrene), or (the food) pasturage

g3543.definition: [νομίζω] from {{g3551}}; properly, to do by law (usage), i.e. to accustom (passively, be usual); by extension, to deem or regard

g3544.definition: [νομικός] from {{g3551}}; according (or pertaining) to law, i.e. legal (ceremonially); as noun, an expert in the (Mosaic) law

g3545.definition: [νομίμως] adverb from a derivative of {{g3551}}; legitimately (specially, agreeably to the rules of the lists)

g3546.definition: [νόμισμα] from {{g3543}}; what is reckoned as of value (after the Latin ), i.e. current coin

g3547.definition: [νομοδιδάσκαλος] from {{g3551}} and {{g1320}}; an expounder of the (Jewish) law, i.e. a Rabbi

g3548.definition: [νομοθεσία] from {{g3550}}; legislation (specially, the institution of the Mosaic code)

g3549.definition: [νομοθετέω] from {{g3550}}; to legislate, i.e. (passively) to have (the Mosaic) enactments injoined, be sanctioned (by them)

g3550.definition: [νομοθέτης] from {{g3551}} and a derivative of {{g5087}}; a legislator

g3551.definition: [νόμος] from a primary νέμω (to parcel out, especially food or grazing to animals); law (through the idea of prescriptive usage), genitive case (regulation), specially, (of Moses (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively (a principle)

g3552.definition: [νοσέω] from {{g3554}}; to be sick, i.e. (by implication, of a diseased appetite) to hanker after (figuratively, to harp upon)

g3554.definition: [νόσος] of uncertain affinity; a malady (rarely figuratively, of moral disability)

g3557.definition: [νοσφίζομαι] middle voice from νοσφί (apart or clandestinely); to sequestrate for oneself, i.e. embezzle

g3558.definition: [νότος] of uncertain affinity; the south(-west) wind; by extension, the southern quarter itself

g3559.definition: [νουθεσία] from {{g3563}} and a derivative of {{g5087}}; calling attention to, i.e. (by implication) mild rebuke or warning

g3560.definition: [νουθετέω] from the same as {{g3559}}; to put in mind, i.e. (by implication) to caution or reprove gently

g3561.definition: [νουμηνία] feminine of a compound of {{g3501}} and {{g3376}} (as noun by implication, of {{g2250}}); the festival of new moon

g3562.definition: [νουνεχῶς] adverb from a comparative of the accusative case of {{g3563}} and {{g2192}}; in a mind-having way, i.e. prudently

g3563.definition: [νοῦς] probably from the base of {{g1097}}; the intellect, i.e. mind (divine or human; in thought, feeling, or will); by implication, meaning Compare {{g5590}}.

g3564.definition: [Νυμφᾶς] probably contracted for a compound of {{g3565}} and {{g1435}}; nymph-given (i.e. -born); Nymphas, a Christian

g3565.definition: [νύμφη] from a primary but obsolete verb νύπτω (to veil as a bride; compare Latin "," to marry); a young married woman (as veiled), including a betrothed girl; by implication, a son's wife

g3568.definition: [νῦν] a primary particle of present time; "now" (as adverb of date, a transition or emphasis); also as noun or adjective present or immediate See also {{g3569}}, {{g3570}}.

g3569.definition: [τανῦν]  or       τὰ νῦνfrom neuter plural of {{g3588}} and {{g3568}}; the things now, i.e. (adverbially) at present

g3570.definition: [νυνί] a prolonged form of {{g3568}} for emphasis; just now

g3572.definition: [νύσσω] apparently a primary word; to prick ("nudge")

g3573.definition: [νυστάζω] from a presumed derivative of {{g3506}}; to nod, i.e. (by implication) to fall asleep; figuratively, to delay

g3574.definition: [νυχθήμερον] from {{g3571}} and {{g2250}}; a day-and-night, i.e. full day of twenty-four hours

g3575.definition: [Νῶε] of Hebrew origin ({{h5146}}); Noë, (i.e. Noäch), a patriarch

g3576.definition: [νωθρός] from a derivative of {{g3541}}; sluggish, i.e. (literally) lazy, or (figuratively) stupid

g3578.definition: [ξενία] from {{g3581}}; hospitality, i.e. (by implication) a place of entertainment

g3579.definition: [ξενίζω] from {{g3581}}; to be a host (passively, a guest); by implication, be (make, appear) strange

g3580.definition: [ξενοδοχέω] from a compound of {{g3581}} and {{g1209}}; to be hospitable

g3581.definition: [ξένος] apparently a primary word; foreign (literally, alien, or figuratively, novel); by implication, a guest or (vice-versa) entertainer

g3582.definition: [ξέστης] as if from ξέω (properly, to smooth; by implication, (of friction) to boil or heat); a vessel (as fashioned or for cooking) (or perhaps by corruption from the Latin , the sixth of a modius, i.e. about a pint), i.e. (specially), a measure for liquids or solids, (by analogy, a pitcher)

g3583.definition: [ξηραίνω] from {{g3584}}; to desiccate; by implication, to shrivel, to mature

g3584.definition: [ξηρός] from the base of {{g3582}} (through the idea of scorching); arid; by implication, shrunken, earth (as opposed to water)

g3586.definition: [ξύλον] from another form of the base of {{g3582}}; timber (as fuel or material); by implication, a stick, club or tree or other wooden article or substance

g3587.definition: [ξυράω] from a derivative of the same as {{g3586}} (meaning a razor); to shave or "shear" the hair

g3588.definition: [ὁ] , including the feminine      ἡ, and the neuter      τό in all their inflections;  the definite article; the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom)

g3591.definition: [ὄγκος] probably from the same as {{g43}}; a mass (as bending or bulging by its load), i.e. burden (hindrance)

g3592.definition: [ὅδε] , including the feminine      ἥδε, and the neuter      τόδεfrom {{g3588}} and {{g1161}}; the same, i.e. this or that one (plural these or those); often used as a personal pronoun

g3594.definition: [ὁδηγέω] from {{g3595}}; to show the way (literally or figuratively (teach))

g3595.definition: [ὁδηγός] from {{g3598}} and {{g2233}}; a conductor (literally or figuratively (teacher))

g3596.definition: [ὁδοιπορέω] from a compound of {{g3598}} and {{g4198}}; to be a wayfarer, i.e. travel

g3598.definition: [ὁδός] apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress (the route, act or distance); figuratively, a mode or means

g3599.definition: [ὀδούς] perhaps from the base of {{g2068}}; a "tooth"
